title:
Emergent broadband polarization entanglement from electronic and
  phononic four-wave mixing indistinguishability
authors:
Diego Sier, Lucas Valente, Tiago A. Freitas, Marcelo F. Santos, Carlos
  H. Monken, Raul Corr\^ea, Ado Jorio
abstract:
Recently [PRA 108, L051501 (2023)], it has been shown that in a
centrosymmetric cubic system, two-photons from a broadband intense laser field
can be converted into a pair of Stokes and anti-Stokes entangled photons. Here
we properly explain, demonstrate, quantify (for diamond) and explore the
possibilities offered by such system, designing an entanglement map based on
changes in the light-matter system. In particular, we show how the broadband
polarization entanglement, that emerges from the interference between
electronic and phononic degrees of freedom in the four-wave mixing process,
depends on parameters such as Stokes-anti-Stokes Raman shift, scattering
geometry and laser bandwidth, opening the avenue of exploration of such
phenomenon in information processing.
